title: Teaching Python to the young and impressionable
summary:
We present two outreach programmes run by Sydney University for high
school students: the National Computer Science School
(http://www.ncss.edu.au) and the Girls' Programming Network
(http://sydney.edu.au/it/gpn). For the past four years we have been
teaching Python to students in grades 9-12, and based on this experience
we will discuss why Python is a good first language and the parts of it
which are still difficult for students to grasp.
